de.esoco.gwt.client.ui

Class DataElementUI<D extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.DataElementUI<D>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigDecimalDataElementUI, BooleanDataElementUI, DataElementListUI, DateDataElementUI, IntegerDataElementUI, PeriodDataElementUI, SelectionDataElementUI, ValueListDataElementUI

    public class DataElementUI<D extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
    An base class for the implementation of user interfaces for single data element objects. All methods have standard implementations that are sufficient for data elements with simple datatypes which implement the method DataElement.setStringValue(String).

      The default gap between components.

        public void addEventListener(de.esoco.ewt.event.EventType eEventType,
                             de.esoco.ewt.event.EwtEventHandler rHandler)
        Adds an event handler to the element component. If the element component is a container the event handler will be added to the container children (in the case of button panels). The source of events received from this registration will be the element component, not this instance.
        Parameters:
        eEventType - The event type to add the handler for
        rHandler - The event handler

                                     de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rStyle)
        Builds the user interface for the data element. This method Invokes buildDataElementUI(ContainerBuilder, StyleData) which can be overridden by subclasses to modify the default building if necessary.

        rBuilder - The container builder to create the components with
        rStyle - The style data for display components

      • collectInput

        public void collectInput(java.util.List<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> rModifiedElements)
        This method must be invoked externally to collect the values from an input user interface into the associated data element. Only after this will the data element contain any new values that have been input by the user. If this instance is not for input the call will be ignored. Therefore it won't harm to invoke this method on display user interfaces too.
        Parameters:
        rModifiedElements - A list to add modified data elements to

      • createElementLabelString

        public java.lang.String createElementLabelString(de.esoco.ewt.UserInterfaceContext rContext)
        Creates the label string for the data element of this instance.
        Parameters:
        rContext - The user interface context for resource expansion
        Returns:
        The Label string (may be emtpy but will never be null

      • buildDataElementUI

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Component buildDataElementUI(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                                              de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rStyle)
        Builds the UI for a data element. Depending on the immutable state of the data element it invokes either createInputUI(ContainerBuilder, StyleData, DataElement) or createDisplayUI(ContainerBuilder, StyleData, DataElement).
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The container builder to create the components with
        rStyle - The style data for display components
        Returns:
        The UI component

      • checkApplyFormatting

        protected java.lang.String checkApplyFormatting(D rDataElement,
                                                de.esoco.ewt.UserInterfaceContext rContext,
                                                java.lang.String sText)
        Checks whether a text string needs to be expanded with format arguments stored in the ContentProperties.FORMAT_ARGUMENTS property. If the property exists it will be tried to replace all occurrences of placeholders (%s) analog to String.format(String, Object...), but only string values are supported. Placeholders may be indexed (e.g. %1$s) in which case they can also occur multiple times. If not enough placeholders occur in the text string any surplus values will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        rDataElement - The data element to check for format arguments
        rContext - The user interface context for resource expansion
        sText - The text string to format
        Returns:
        The formatted string

      • checkRequestFocus

        protected void checkRequestFocus()
        Checks whether the data element has the StateProperties.FOCUSED flag and if so sets the input focus on the element component.

      • containsResourceIds

        protected boolean containsResourceIds(de.esoco.data.validate.Validator<?> rValidator)
        A helper method that checks whether a certain validator contains a list of resource IDs.
        Parameters:
        rValidator - The validator to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if the validator contains resource IDs

      • convertValueToString

        protected java.lang.String convertValueToString(de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?> rDataElement,
                                                java.lang.Object rValue)
        Returns a string representation of a value that is related to a certain data element. Related means that it is either the data element value itself or of the element's validator. This method can be overridden by subclasses to modify the standard display of data elements. It will be invoked by the default implementations of the component creation methods.

        The default implementation returns the toString() result for the value or an empty string if the value is NULL.

        Parameters:
        rDataElement - The data element to convert the value for
        rValue - The value to convert
        Returns:
        The element display string

      • createButton

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Component createButton(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                                        de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rStyle,
                                                        D rDataElement)
        Creates a label component.
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The builder
        rStyle - The style
        rDataElement - The data element to create the label for
        Returns:
        The new component

      • createDisplayUI

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Component createDisplayUI(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                                           de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rStyle,
                                                           D rDataElement)
        This method can be overridden by subclasses to create the user interface for a data element that is either immutable or for display only. The default implementation creates a label with the string-converted value of the data element as returned by convertValueToString(DataElement, Object).
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The container builder to create the components with
        rStyle - The default style data for the display components
        rDataElement - The data element to create the UI for
        Returns:
        The display user interface component

      • createElementLabel

        protected void createElementLabel(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                  de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rStyle,
                                  java.lang.String sLabel)
        Creates a label with the given container builder.
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The container builder to add the label with
        rStyle - The default label style
        sLabel - The label string

      • createHyperlinkDisplayComponent

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Component createHyperlinkDisplayComponent(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                                                           de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rStyle,
                                                                           D rDataElement)
        Creates a display component to render hyperlinks.
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The container builder
        rStyle - The style data
        rDataElement - The data element
        Returns:
        The new hyperlink component

      • createInputUI

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Component createInputUI(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                                         de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rStyle,
                                                         D rDataElement)
        Must be overridden by subclasses to modify the creation of the user interface components for the editing of the data element's value. The default implementation creates either a TextField with the value returned by convertValueToString(DataElement, Object) or a list if the data element's value is constrained by a ListValidator. The list values will be read from the validator, converted with the above method, and finally expanded as resources. The creation of these components is handled by #createEditComponent(ContainerBuilder, StyleData, DataElement).
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The container builder to create the components with
        rStyle - The default style data for the input components
        rDataElement - The data element to create the UI for
        Returns:
        The input user interface component or NULL if it shall not be handled by this instance

      • createInteractionHandler

        protected DataElementInteractionHandler<D> createInteractionHandler(DataElementPanelManager rPanelManager,
                                                                    D rDataElement)
        Creates the interaction handler for this instances. Subclasses may override this method to return their own type of interaction handler.
        Parameters:
        rPanelManager -
        rDataElement -
        Returns:
        The data element interaction handler

      • createUrlComponent

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Component createUrlComponent(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                                              de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rDisplayStyle,
                                                              de.esoco.lib.property.ContentType eContentType)
        Adds the component for the display of data elements with a URL content type.
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The container builder to create the components with
        rDisplayStyle - The default style data for the display components
        eContentType - TRUE for a relative and FALSE for an absolute URL
        Returns:
        The URL component

      • enableComponent

        protected void enableComponent(boolean bEnable)
        Enables or disables the user interface component(s) of this instance. If the component is an instance of Container the enabled state of it's child elements will be changed instead.
        Parameters:
        bEnable - TRUE to enable the user interface

      • enableComponent

        protected void enableComponent(de.esoco.ewt.component.Component rComponent,
                               boolean bEnabled)
        Enables or disables a certain component. If the component is an instance of Container the enabled state of it's child elements will be changed instead.
        Parameters:
        rComponent - The component to enable or disable
        bEnabled - TRUE to enable the user interface

      • enableInteraction

        protected void enableInteraction(boolean bEnabled)
        Enables or disables interactions through this panel manager's user interface. This default implementation stores the current enabled state and then disables or restores the enabled state of the element component through the method enableComponent(boolean).
        Parameters:
        bEnabled - TRUE to enable interaction, FALSE to disable

      • formatDate

        protected java.lang.String formatDate(de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?> rDataElement,
                                      java.util.Date rDate)
        Formats a date value from a data element. If the data element has the property ContentProperties.FORMAT this format string will be used to format the date value. Else the property ContentProperties.CONTENT_TYPE is queried for the date and/or time content type.
        Parameters:
        rDataElement - The data element the value has been read from
        rDate - The date value of the data element
        Returns:
        A string containing the formatted date value

      • isEnabled

        protected boolean isEnabled()
        Returns the enabled state of this UIs component(s).
        Returns:
        The current enabled state

      • openUrl

        protected void openUrl(java.lang.String sUrl,
                       boolean bHidden)
        Opens a URL in a page or a hidden frame.
        Parameters:
        sUrl - The URL to open
        bHidden - TRUE to open the URL in a hidden frame, FALSE to open it in a new browser page

      • setEnabled

        protected void setEnabled(boolean bEnabled)
        Sets the enabled state of this UI's component(s) and stores the enabled state internally.
        Parameters:
        bEnabled - The new enabled state

      • setHiddenLabelHint

        protected void setHiddenLabelHint(de.esoco.ewt.UserInterfaceContext rContext)
        Sets a hint for the component if the element label is not visible. The default implementation sets the label text as the component tooltip but subclasses can override this method.
        Parameters:
        rContext - The builder the element UI has been built with

      • setupInteractionHandling

        protected void setupInteractionHandling(de.esoco.ewt.component.Component rComponent,
                                        boolean bOnContainerChildren)
        Initializes the handling of interaction events for a certain component if necessary.
        Parameters:
        rComponent - The component to setup the input handling for
        bOnContainerChildren - TRUE to setup the input handling for the children if the component is a container

      • transferDataElementValueToComponent

        protected void transferDataElementValueToComponent(D rDataElement,
                                                   de.esoco.ewt.component.Component rComponent)
        Transfers the value of a data element into a component. Must be overridden by subclasses that use special components to render data elements. This default implementation handles the standard components that are created by this base class.

        This method will be invoked from the updateValue() method if the UI needs to be updated from the model data (i.e. from the data element).

        Parameters:
        rDataElement - The data element to transfer the value of
        rComponent - The component to set the value of

      • transferInputToDataElement

        protected void transferInputToDataElement(de.esoco.ewt.component.Component rComponent,
                                          D rDataElement)
        Must be overridden by subclasses to modify the default transfer of input values from the user interface components to the data element. This method will only be invoked if this instance is in input mode and the data element is not immutable.

        The default implementation expects either a text field or a list as created by createInputUI(ContainerBuilder, StyleData, DataElement). In the first case it invokes the DataElement.setStringValue(String) method with the field value. For a list the selected value will be read from the element's list validator.

        Parameters:
        rComponent - The component to read the input from
        rDataElement - The data element to set the value of

      • transferTextInput

        protected void transferTextInput(de.esoco.lib.property.TextAttribute rComponent,
                                 D rDataElement)
        Transfers the input from a component with a text attribute to a data element.
        Parameters:
        rComponent - The source text attribute component
        rDataElement - The target data element

      • updateTextComponent

        protected void updateTextComponent(de.esoco.ewt.component.TextControl rTextComponent)
        Updates the state of a text component from the properties of the data element.
        Parameters:
        rTextComponent - The component to update

      • updateValue

        protected void updateValue()
        Updates the value of the element component if the data element value has changed.
